etymologies: late 16th century: from Dutch bamboes, based on Malay mambu

definitions: a giant woody grass that grows chiefly in the tropics, where it is widely cultivated.

notes.text: Bambusa and other genera, family Gramineae

shortDefinitions: giant woody grass which is grown chiefly in tropics

definitions: the hollow jointed stem of the bamboo plant, used as a cane or to make furniture and implements
shortDefinitions: hollow jointed stem of this plant, used as cane
